On Thu, 2003-04-10 at 12:05, Herr Christian Wolfgang Hujer wrote: 

[snip a lot of rhetoric]

So... we are debating semantics.  From a specification standpoint it
doesn't exist.  From a readable code standpoint, it does.

public class A {
    private static class B {
    }
}

It's a definition of a static class inside another class.  Who cares
what you call it? ;)

=jason
